00057 static void foreach_nodetree(Main *main, void *calldata, bNodeTreeCallback func)
00058 {
00059     Tex *tx;
00060     for (tx= main->tex.first; tx; tx= tx->id.next) {
00061         if (tx->nodetree) {
00062             func(calldata, &tx->id, tx->nodetree);
00063         }
00064     }
00065 }
00066 
00067 static void foreach_nodeclass(Scene *UNUSED(scene), void *calldata, bNodeClassCallback func)
00068 {
00069     func(calldata, NODE_CLASS_INPUT, IFACE_("Input"));
00070     func(calldata, NODE_CLASS_OUTPUT, IFACE_("Output"));
00071     func(calldata, NODE_CLASS_OP_COLOR, IFACE_("Color"));
00072     func(calldata, NODE_CLASS_PATTERN, IFACE_("Patterns"));
00073     func(calldata, NODE_CLASS_TEXTURE, IFACE_("Textures"));
00074     func(calldata, NODE_CLASS_CONVERTOR, IFACE_("Convertor"));
00075     func(calldata, NODE_CLASS_DISTORT, IFACE_("Distort"));
00076     func(calldata, NODE_CLASS_GROUP, IFACE_("Group"));
00077     func(calldata, NODE_CLASS_LAYOUT, IFACE_("Layout"));
00078 }

00080 static void localize(bNodeTree *localtree, bNodeTree *UNUSED(ntree))
00081 {
00082     bNode *node, *node_next;
00083     
00084     /* replace muted nodes by internal links */
00085     for (node= localtree->nodes.first; node; node= node_next) {
00086         node_next = node->next;
00087         
00088         if (node->flag & NODE_MUTED) {
00089             nodeInternalRelink(localtree, node);
00090             nodeFreeNode(localtree, node);
00091         }
00092     }
00093 }
00094 
00095 static void local_sync(bNodeTree *localtree, bNodeTree *ntree)
00096 {
00097     bNode *lnode;
00098     
00099     /* copy over contents of previews */
00100     for (lnode= localtree->nodes.first; lnode; lnode= lnode->next) {
00101         if (ntreeNodeExists(ntree, lnode->new_node)) {
00102             bNode *node= lnode->new_node;
00103             
00104             if (node->preview && node->preview->rect) {
00105                 if (lnode->preview && lnode->preview->rect) {
00106                     int xsize= node->preview->xsize;
00107                     int ysize= node->preview->ysize;
00108                     memcpy(node->preview->rect, lnode->preview->rect, 4*xsize + xsize*ysize*sizeof(char)*4);
00109                 }
00110             }
00111         }
00112     }
00113 }

00134 int ntreeTexTagAnimated(bNodeTree *ntree)
00135 {
00136     bNode *node;
00137     
00138     if (ntree==NULL) return 0;
00139     
00140     for (node= ntree->nodes.first; node; node= node->next) {
00141         if (node->type==TEX_NODE_CURVE_TIME) {
00142             nodeUpdate(ntree, node);
00143             return 1;
00144         }
00145         else if (node->type==NODE_GROUP) {
00146             if ( ntreeTexTagAnimated((bNodeTree *)node->id) ) {
00147                 return 1;
00148             }
00149         }
00150     }
00151     
00152     return 0;
00153 }
00154 
00155 /* XXX Group nodes must set use_tree_data to false, since their trees can be shared by multiple nodes.
00156  * If use_tree_data is true, the ntree->execdata pointer is checked to avoid multiple execution of top-level trees.
00157  */
00158 bNodeTreeExec *ntreeTexBeginExecTree(bNodeTree *ntree, int use_tree_data)
00159 {
00160     bNodeTreeExec *exec;
00161     bNode *node;
00162     
00163     if (use_tree_data) {
00164         /* XXX hack: prevent exec data from being generated twice.
00165          * this should be handled by the renderer!
00166          */
00167         if (ntree->execdata)
00168             return ntree->execdata;
00169     }
00170     
00171     /* common base initialization */
00172     exec = ntree_exec_begin(ntree);
00173     
00174     /* allocate the thread stack listbase array */
00175     exec->threadstack= MEM_callocN(BLENDER_MAX_THREADS*sizeof(ListBase), "thread stack array");
00176     
00177     for (node= exec->nodetree->nodes.first; node; node= node->next)
00178         node->need_exec= 1;
00179     
00180     if (use_tree_data) {
00181         /* XXX this should not be necessary, but is still used for cmp/sha/tex nodes,
00182          * which only store the ntree pointer. Should be fixed at some point!
00183          */
00184         ntree->execdata = exec;
00185     }
00186     
00187     return exec;
00188 }
00189 
00190 /* free texture delegates */
00191 static void tex_free_delegates(bNodeTreeExec *exec)
00192 {
00193     bNodeThreadStack *nts;
00194     bNodeStack *ns;
00195     int th, a;
00196     
00197     for (th=0; th<BLENDER_MAX_THREADS; th++)
00198         for (nts=exec->threadstack[th].first; nts; nts=nts->next)
00199             for (ns= nts->stack, a=0; a<exec->stacksize; a++, ns++)
00200                 if (ns->data && !ns->is_copy)
00201                     MEM_freeN(ns->data);
00202 }
00203 
00204 /* XXX Group nodes must set use_tree_data to false, since their trees can be shared by multiple nodes.
00205  * If use_tree_data is true, the ntree->execdata pointer is checked to avoid multiple execution of top-level trees.
00206  */
00207 void ntreeTexEndExecTree(bNodeTreeExec *exec, int use_tree_data)
00208 {
00209     if (exec) {
00210         bNodeTree *ntree= exec->nodetree;
00211         bNodeThreadStack *nts;
00212         int a;
00213         
00214         if (exec->threadstack) {
00215             tex_free_delegates(exec);
00216             
00217             for (a=0; a<BLENDER_MAX_THREADS; a++) {
00218                 for (nts=exec->threadstack[a].first; nts; nts=nts->next)
00219                     if (nts->stack) MEM_freeN(nts->stack);
00220                 BLI_freelistN(&exec->threadstack[a]);
00221             }
00222             
00223             MEM_freeN(exec->threadstack);
00224             exec->threadstack= NULL;
00225         }
00226         
00227         ntree_exec_end(exec);
00228         
00229         if (use_tree_data) {
00230             /* XXX clear nodetree backpointer to exec data, same problem as noted in ntreeBeginExecTree */
00231             ntree->execdata = NULL;
00232         }
00233     }
00234 }
00235 
00236 int ntreeTexExecTree(
00237     bNodeTree *nodes,
00238     TexResult *texres,
00239     float *co,
00240     float *dxt, float *dyt,
00241     int osatex,
00242     short thread, 
00243     Tex *UNUSED(tex), 
00244     short which_output, 
00245     int cfra,
00246     int preview,
00247     ShadeInput *shi,
00248     MTex *mtex
00249 ) {
00250     TexCallData data;
00251     float *nor= texres->nor;
00252     int retval = TEX_INT;
00253     bNodeThreadStack *nts = NULL;
00254     bNodeTreeExec *exec= nodes->execdata;
00255 
00256     data.co = co;
00257     data.dxt = dxt;
00258     data.dyt = dyt;
00259     data.osatex = osatex;
00260     data.target = texres;
00261     data.do_preview = preview;
00262     data.thread = thread;
00263     data.which_output = which_output;
00264     data.cfra= cfra;
00265     data.mtex= mtex;
00266     data.shi= shi;
00267     
00268     /* ensure execdata is only initialized once */
00269     if (!exec) {
00270         BLI_lock_thread(LOCK_NODES);
00271         if (!nodes->execdata)
00272             ntreeTexBeginExecTree(nodes, 1);
00273         BLI_unlock_thread(LOCK_NODES);
00274 
00275         exec= nodes->execdata;
00276     }
00277     
00278     nts= ntreeGetThreadStack(exec, thread);
00279     ntreeExecThreadNodes(exec, nts, &data, thread);
00280     ntreeReleaseThreadStack(nts);
00281 
00282     if (texres->nor) retval |= TEX_NOR;
00283     retval |= TEX_RGB;
00284     /* confusing stuff; the texture output node sets this to NULL to indicate no normal socket was set
00285        however, the texture code checks this for other reasons (namely, a normal is required for material) */
00286     texres->nor= nor;
00287 
00288     return retval;
00289 }
